normalised: Good news, folks! Getting solar panels on your chhat (roof) just got easier and cheaper! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E) is still offering sweet subsidies on rooftop solar installations, especially for residential properties.

unnormalised: Good news, folks! Getting solar panels on your chhat (roof) just got easier and cheaper! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) is still offering sweet subsidies on rooftop solar installations, especially for residential properties.
normalised: Thinking of going solar in your Pune apartment, or on your independent house in Chennai? Now's the time! Depending on the size of your installation, you can snag a hefty discount. We're talking potentially reducing the initial cost by a significant chunk.

unnormalised: Thinking of going solar in your Pune apartment, or on your independent house in Chennai? Now's the time! Depending on the size of your installation, you can snag a hefty discount. We're talking potentially reducing the initial cost by a significant chunk.
normalised: Doctor Sharma from I I T Delhi says this is a "golden opportunity" for average citizens to embrace green energy. The subsidies are tiered, generally offering more incentives for smaller installations. For example, for a three kilowatt system covering around three hundred square feet, you could save a considerable amount!

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma from IIT Delhi says this is a "golden opportunity" for average citizens to embrace green energy. The subsidies are tiered, generally offering more incentives for smaller installations. For example, for a 3kW system covering around 300 sq ft, you could save a considerable amount!
normalised: Check with your local electricity distribution company (discom) for the exact subsidy amount applicable in your area. Don't delay, though – these schemes are often subject to change. Could save you some serious rupees in the long run! Think of all the gulab jamuns you could buy!

unnormalised: Check with your local electricity distribution company (discom) for the exact subsidy amount applicable in your area. Don't delay, though – these schemes are often subject to change. Could save you some serious Rs. in the long run! Think of all the gulab jamuns you could buy!
